summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case. The order denies Maxwell's request to have the MDC warden personally appear to answer questions about her confinement conditions but mandates the government to provide written status updates every 60 days regarding her access to legal materials and communication with counsel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who raised concerns about her conditions of confinement at MDC and requested the warden be summoned.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge who issued the order denying Maxwell's request and mandating government status updates.

persons.name: Heriberto Tellez
persons.context: The warden of the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) whom Maxwell requested be summoned to personally respond to questions about her confinement conditions.

connections.description: Maxwell is a detainee at the MDC facility where Tellez is the warden; she requested he be summoned to court regarding her confinement conditions.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case and issued this order regarding her confinement conditions.

events.title: Maxwell's Letter on Confinement Conditions
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell submitted a letter to the court raising concerns about her conditions of confinement at MDC.

events.title: MDC Legal Counsel Response
events.description: MDC legal counsel submitted a letter to the court responding to the concerns Maxwell raised about her confinement conditions.

events.title: Maxwell's Response to MDC Letter
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell responded to the MDC legal counsel's letter, reiterating her request that Warden Tellez be summoned to personally respond to questions.

events.title: Court Order on Confinement Conditions
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order denying Maxwell's request to summon the warden but ordering the government to provide written status updates every 60 days on her confinement conditions.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied Ghislaine Maxwell's request to have MDC Warden Heriberto Tellez personally appear in court to answer questions about her confinement conditions.

The court ordered the government to submit written status updates every 60 days detailing any material changes to Maxwell's confinement conditions, with emphasis on her access to legal materials and ability to communicate with defense counsel.

The order specifically requires updates on the frequency of searches of Maxwell and mandates the government take steps to ensure she continues to receive adequate access to legal materials and counsel communication.
